meanings.definition: An official who investigates and determines the cause of death in cases of suspicious or violent deaths.
meanings.sent1: The coroners examined the body to find out why the person died.
meanings.sent2: The coroners were called to the crime scene to investigate the mysterious death.
meanings.sent3: The coroners joked that their job was to solve the ultimate mystery - death itself.
meanings.sent4: The coroners were like detectives of the deceased, uncovering the secrets hidden in the bodies.
meanings.sent5: The coroners' job was to unveil the truth behind each life's final chapter.
